name: National Museum of Taiwan Literature | Digital Game Development and Collection 3D Scanning Project | Website
desc: This project digitizes museum collections through 3D scanning and modeling, then invites the public to submit game scripts using these artifacts as creative elements, translating the collections into new story texts.

Through VR experiences, online games, and motion-based interactive games, plus research-driven storytelling, it makes Taiwanese literature approachable and connects with visitors’ personal experiences—narrowing the gap to literature while revitalizing the artifacts.
Five completed items under this project: digital games “Keeper of Characters: Demon Hunt,” “1940,” “Bird of Life,” “Isles of Monsters,” and the “3D Scanning and Modeling Project.”
This is the second version, featuring a major visual redesign and a WordPress CMS/database so the client can easily add and edit content.

name: National Taiwan Arts Education Center | Dreamscape Journey: Picture Book Art Exhibition | Website
desc: “Dreamscape Journey: Picture Book Art Exhibition” features 10 picture books from Taiwan and abroad suitable for parents and children to read and play together. Stories and illustrations are brought to life in immersive interactive scenes—inviting families into a charming picture-book world. The exhibit has a first-floor “Goodnight House” for scenography and a second-floor “Dream Room” for tech interactions.
This event site uses playful visuals and rich content planning so visitors can fully understand the exhibition even remotely.

name: National Museum of Taiwan Literature | Heritage Guide Download Site | Website
desc: The download site for the museum’s heritage guide app; on entry, the program detects the device to decide what to show.
iOS visitors see the App Store link, Android visitors see Google Play, and macOS/Windows users see a third screen since no platform version exists.

name: Three.js Christmas Tree | Side Project
desc: A friend’s company needed an animated Christmas greeting card, so I built a Three.js Christmas tree for them.
All geometry is procedurally drawn—no model files were used.

name: National Museum of Taiwan Literature | Origami Puppet AR | Interactive AR Game
desc: An interactive AR activity for Children’s Day 2021 at the National Museum of Taiwan Literature.
Tablet AR captures doodles on a target sheet, converts them into a material texture, and maps them onto the target 3D model.
※ Image 1: the original real-world drawing
※ Image 2: tablet view after scanning—AR captures the doodle, turns it into a texture, and maps it onto the model.

name: National Museum of Taiwan Literature | Light & Shadow Tailor Shop: Cold and Unexpected | Interactive Picture Book Theater
desc: Located in the museum’s basement Literature Paradise, this immersive children’s theater brings the picture book “Cold and Unexpected” to life. Kids become apprentices, fixing the story with their creations. Through performance and interactive games—motion and sound capture—the storyteller leads them into WWII Taiwan as portrayed by Yang Yun-Ping, highlighting the father–daughter bond with Yang Chen-Chen and the wartime streets of Taiwan.

“Light & Shadow Tailor Shop” is an interactive projection system where users can edit and add scripts. Three blended projectors display predesigned content on an interactive wall. A customizable lighting system syncs with projections to enrich storytelling. The space also embeds interactive devices—radar sensors, microphones, Kinect motion sensing, and an optical scanner—turning the audience into participants.
“Cold and Unexpected” is the first script in the Light & Shadow Tailor Shop series.
works: Radar interaction content and signal integration
Build output, onsite setup, and maintenance

name: National Museum of Taiwan Literature | Isles of Monsters | Multi-platform VR Game
desc: A fantasy-island concept inspired by five writers—Ye Shitao, Zhang Shenqie, Lung Ying-Tsung, Lin Hai-yin, and Yao Yi-wei—and five scanned artifacts: Ye Shitao’s rattan chair, Zhang Shenqie’s autograph book, Lung Ying-Tsung’s wheelchair, Lin Hai-yin’s elephant figurine, and Yao Yi-wei’s voyage suitcase. These become level props in a first-person VR shooter.
Released on Steam for PC and also on Google Play, the App Store, and Oculus Lab.

name: Little Son AR Adventure | Interactive AR Game App
desc: Four classic scenes from the “Little Son” comic series:

Episode 1 “Imagination Bug”:
Start with the origin animation of the Imagination Bug!

Episode 2 “A-Ning and His Robot”:
Oh no! A-Ning’s robot made a mess—clean up before mom gets home!

Episode 4 “Duan-Duan’s 4D Lab”:
The Imagination Bug is missing in the lab—find it fast before disaster strikes!

Episode 7 “Gluttonous T-Rex”:
The T-Rex is on a rampage—help dad avoid junk food to get back to normal!

How to play:
Find the hinted panels in the comic and scan them to reveal the corresponding 3D model. Place the model on a flat surface to explore the AR world!
works: Game physics and environment interaction system
